bloomberg.com.notes: High trust, comprehensive financial data and news.

wsj.com.name: Wall Street Journal
wsj.com.notes: High trust, US focused, business and finance.

investing.com.notes: Broad coverage, includes user-generated content caution.

finance.yahoo.com.notes: Good for aggregated news, variable quality of original content.

marketwatch.com.notes: Timely market news, owned by Dow Jones.

seekingalpha.com.notes: Variable quality, opinions mixed with news. Use with caution for factual reporting.

thestreet.com.notes: Mix of news and strong opinions.

forbes.com.notes: Generally reputable, but includes contributed content of varying quality.

businessinsider.com.notes: Often quick with news, can be sensationalist at times.

coindesk.com.notes: Leading site for crypto news, generally reliable in that niche.

someblog.com.notes: Low trust, example of a less reputable source.

randomnewsblog.net.notes: Very low trust, example of a source to generally ignore.
